001// Copyright (c) FIRST and other WPILib contributors.
002// Open Source Software; you can modify and/or share it under the terms of

004
005package edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.button;
006
007import static edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.util.ErrorMessages.requireNonNullParam;
008
009import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Command;
010import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.CommandScheduler;
011import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.InstantCommand;
012import edu.wpi.first.wpilibj2.command.Subsystem;
013import java.util.function.BooleanSupplier;
014
015/**
016 * This class provides an easy way to link commands to inputs.
017 *
018 * <p>It is very easy to link a button to a command. For instance, you could link the trigger button
019 * of a joystick to a "score" command.
020 *
021 * <p>It is encouraged that teams write a subclass of Trigger if they want to have something unusual
022 * (for instance, if they want to react to the user holding a button while the robot is reading a
023 * certain sensor input). For this, they only have to write the {@link Trigger#get()} method to get
024 * the full functionality of the Trigger class.
025 */
026public class Trigger {
027  private final BooleanSupplier m_isActive;
028
029  /**
030   * Creates a new trigger with the given condition determining whether it is active.
031   *
032   * @param isActive returns whether or not the trigger should be active
033   */
034  public Trigger(BooleanSupplier isActive) {
035    m_isActive = isActive;
036  }
037
038  /**
039   * Creates a new trigger that is always inactive. Useful only as a no-arg constructor for
040   * subclasses that will be overriding {@link Trigger#get()} anyway.
041   */
042  public Trigger() {
043    m_isActive = () -> false;
044  }
045
046  /**
047   * Returns whether or not the trigger is active.
048   *
049   * <p>This method will be called repeatedly a command is linked to the Trigger.
050   *
051   * @return whether or not the trigger condition is active.
052   */
053  public boolean get() {
054    return m_isActive.getAsBoolean();
055  }
056
057  /**
058   * Starts the given command whenever the trigger just becomes active.
059   *
060   * @param command the command to start
061   * @param interruptible whether the command is interruptible
062   * @return this trigger, so calls can be chained
063   */
064  public Trigger whenActive(final Command command, boolean interruptible) {
065    requireNonNullParam(command, "command", "whenActive");
066
067    CommandScheduler.getInstance()
068        .addButton(
069            new Runnable() {
070              private boolean m_pressedLast = get();
071
072              @Override
073              public void run() {
074                boolean pressed = get();
075
076                if (!m_pressedLast && pressed) {
077                  command.schedule(interruptible);
078                }
079
080                m_pressedLast = pressed;
081              }
082            });
083
084    return this;
085  }
086
087  /**
088   * Starts the given command whenever the trigger just becomes active. The command is set to be
089   * interruptible.
090   *
091   * @param command the command to start
092   * @return this trigger, so calls can be chained
093   */
094  public Trigger whenActive(final Command command) {
095    return whenActive(command, true);
096  }
097
098  /**
099   * Runs the given runnable whenever the trigger just becomes active.
100   *
101   * @param toRun the runnable to run
102   * @param requirements the required subsystems
103   * @return this trigger, so calls can be chained
104   */
105  public Trigger whenActive(final Runnable toRun, Subsystem... requirements) {
106    return whenActive(new InstantCommand(toRun, requirements));
107  }
108
109  /**
110   * Constantly starts the given command while the button is held.
111   *
112   * <p>{@link Command#schedule(boolean)} will be called repeatedly while the trigger is active, and
113   * will be canceled when the trigger becomes inactive.
114   *
115   * @param command the command to start
116   * @param interruptible whether the command is interruptible
117   * @return this trigger, so calls can be chained
118   */
119  public Trigger whileActiveContinuous(final Command command, boolean interruptible) {
120    requireNonNullParam(command, "command", "whileActiveContinuous");
121
122    CommandScheduler.getInstance()
123        .addButton(
124            new Runnable() {
125              private boolean m_pressedLast = get();
126
127              @Override
128              public void run() {
129                boolean pressed = get();
130
131                if (pressed) {
132                  command.schedule(interruptible);
133                } else if (m_pressedLast) {
134                  command.cancel();
135                }
136
137                m_pressedLast = pressed;
138              }
139            });
140    return this;
141  }
142
143  /**
144   * Constantly starts the given command while the button is held.
145   *
146   * <p>{@link Command#schedule(boolean)} will be called repeatedly while the trigger is active, and
147   * will be canceled when the trigger becomes inactive. The command is set to be interruptible.
148   *
149   * @param command the command to start
150   * @return this trigger, so calls can be chained
151   */
152  public Trigger whileActiveContinuous(final Command command) {
153    return whileActiveContinuous(command, true);
154  }
155
156  /**
157   * Constantly runs the given runnable while the button is held.
158   *
159   * @param toRun the runnable to run
160   * @param requirements the required subsystems
161   * @return this trigger, so calls can be chained
162   */
163  public Trigger whileActiveContinuous(final Runnable toRun, Subsystem... requirements) {
164    return whileActiveContinuous(new InstantCommand(toRun, requirements));
165  }
166
167  /**
168   * Starts the given command when the trigger initially becomes active, and ends it when it becomes
169   * inactive, but does not re-start it in-between.
170   *
171   * @param command the command to start
172   * @param interruptible whether the command is interruptible
173   * @return this trigger, so calls can be chained
174   */
175  public Trigger whileActiveOnce(final Command command, boolean interruptible) {
176    requireNonNullParam(command, "command", "whileActiveOnce");
177
178    CommandScheduler.getInstance()
179        .addButton(
180            new Runnable() {
181              private boolean m_pressedLast = get();
182
183              @Override
184              public void run() {
185                boolean pressed = get();
186
187                if (!m_pressedLast && pressed) {
188                  command.schedule(interruptible);
189                } else if (m_pressedLast && !pressed) {
190                  command.cancel();
191                }
192
193                m_pressedLast = pressed;
194              }
195            });
196    return this;
197  }
198
199  /**
200   * Starts the given command when the trigger initially becomes active, and ends it when it becomes
201   * inactive, but does not re-start it in-between. The command is set to be interruptible.
202   *
203   * @param command the command to start
204   * @return this trigger, so calls can be chained
205   */
206  public Trigger whileActiveOnce(final Command command) {
207    return whileActiveOnce(command, true);
208  }
209
210  /**
211   * Starts the command when the trigger becomes inactive.
212   *
213   * @param command the command to start
214   * @param interruptible whether the command is interruptible
215   * @return this trigger, so calls can be chained
216   */
217  public Trigger whenInactive(final Command command, boolean interruptible) {
218    requireNonNullParam(command, "command", "whenInactive");
219
220    CommandScheduler.getInstance()
221        .addButton(
222            new Runnable() {
223              private boolean m_pressedLast = get();
224
225              @Override
226              public void run() {
227                boolean pressed = get();
228
229                if (m_pressedLast && !pressed) {
230                  command.schedule(interruptible);
231                }
232
233                m_pressedLast = pressed;
234              }
235            });
236    return this;
237  }
238
239  /**
240   * Starts the command when the trigger becomes inactive. The command is set to be interruptible.
241   *
242   * @param command the command to start
243   * @return this trigger, so calls can be chained
244   */
245  public Trigger whenInactive(final Command command) {
246    return whenInactive(command, true);
247  }
248
249  /**
250   * Runs the given runnable when the trigger becomes inactive.
251   *
252   * @param toRun the runnable to run
253   * @param requirements the required subsystems
254   * @return this trigger, so calls can be chained
255   */
256  public Trigger whenInactive(final Runnable toRun, Subsystem... requirements) {
257    return whenInactive(new InstantCommand(toRun, requirements));
258  }
259
260  /**
261   * Toggles a command when the trigger becomes active.
262   *
263   * @param command the command to toggle
264   * @param interruptible whether the command is interruptible
265   * @return this trigger, so calls can be chained
266   */
267  public Trigger toggleWhenActive(final Command command, boolean interruptible) {
268    requireNonNullParam(command, "command", "toggleWhenActive");
269
270    CommandScheduler.getInstance()
271        .addButton(
272            new Runnable() {
273              private boolean m_pressedLast = get();
274
275              @Override
276              public void run() {
277                boolean pressed = get();
278
279                if (!m_pressedLast && pressed) {
280                  if (command.isScheduled()) {
281                    command.cancel();
282                  } else {
283                    command.schedule(interruptible);
284                  }
285                }
286
287                m_pressedLast = pressed;
288              }
289            });
290    return this;
291  }
292
293  /**
294   * Toggles a command when the trigger becomes active. The command is set to be interruptible.
295   *
296   * @param command the command to toggle
297   * @return this trigger, so calls can be chained
298   */
299  public Trigger toggleWhenActive(final Command command) {
300    return toggleWhenActive(command, true);
301  }
302
303  /**
304   * Cancels a command when the trigger becomes active.
305   *
306   * @param command the command to cancel
307   * @return this trigger, so calls can be chained
308   */
309  public Trigger cancelWhenActive(final Command command) {
310    requireNonNullParam(command, "command", "cancelWhenActive");
311
312    CommandScheduler.getInstance()
313        .addButton(
314            new Runnable() {
315              private boolean m_pressedLast = get();
316
317              @Override
318              public void run() {
319                boolean pressed = get();
320
321                if (!m_pressedLast && pressed) {
322                  command.cancel();
323                }
324
325                m_pressedLast = pressed;
326              }
327            });
328    return this;
329  }
330
331  /**
332   * Composes this trigger with another trigger, returning a new trigger that is active when both
333   * triggers are active.
334   *
335   * @param trigger the trigger to compose with
336   * @return the trigger that is active when both triggers are active
337   */
338  public Trigger and(Trigger trigger) {
339    return new Trigger(() -> get() && trigger.get());
340  }
341
342  /**
343   * Composes this trigger with another trigger, returning a new trigger that is active when either
344   * trigger is active.
345   *
346   * @param trigger the trigger to compose with
347   * @return the trigger that is active when either trigger is active
348   */
349  public Trigger or(Trigger trigger) {
350    return new Trigger(() -> get() || trigger.get());
351  }
352
353  /**
354   * Creates a new trigger that is active when this trigger is inactive, i.e. that acts as the
355   * negation of this trigger.
356   *
357   * @return the negated trigger
358   */
359  public Trigger negate() {
360    return new Trigger(() -> !get());
361  }
362}
